entry.title: Movie: White House Down, starring Channing Tatum (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: White House Down, starring Channing Tatum (2013)20131028
This was a great movie. I enjoyed it a lot more than "Olympus Has
Fallen". I think I liked it better because it more "home-y" and had
more than just action elements: there was Tatum's romancing family
wholesomeness, the comedic moments, the variety of styles of action
scenes, and the mystery of what exactly was happening. I enjoyed it
quite a bit. Roland Emmerich is pretty great.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (remake) (DS, 2006) (8)20131027
I played for about two hours today and finished the Tide Cave,
unlocked part of the Dark World, and got the Water Crystal jobs. I
don't plan on using any of them, but I will use Earth Crystal
jobs---Devout and Black Belt, I think. I died my first time
against Krakken, so I grinded a bit to get my Knights to do more
damage (although they are nowhere near as good as my Warriors
were) and then I went back to the Light World to get the Light
Staff for the healer. After doing all this, it was tight but not
too hard.

Total time: 11:13
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 3 (remake)
  • DS
  • 2006

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (11)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (11)20131027
I finished the main book today, although I will still read the
essays that are attached to it. The majority of the end of the book
kind of falls apart and is hard to appreciate today, unlike the
opening which feels very pertinent.
  • Books
  • 1651

entry.title: Movie: The Long Ranger, starring Armie Hammer (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Long Ranger, starring Armie Hammer (2013)20131027
This was fun movie. I haven't watched a Western in a long time, so
it felt fresh to be in that world. I thought that the movie was
trying way too hard to be something like Pirates. Tonto's weird
quirks and some of the action moments are the best examples. I felt
like the plot was all over the place and the movie went a very long
distance throughout it. I didn't feel confused, but I could easily
imagine why someone might be confused. I didn't like the
presentation it had of Indians, despite seeming to be on their
side. Overall, I enjoyed the movie, but thought it could have been
better.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: After Earth, starring Jaden Smith (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: After Earth, starring Jaden Smith (2013)20131026
This was a fun movie. I liked the world that it created and the
chase-like drama of it. I thought the acting and details of the
story were mostly forgettable. The idea that warriors had to evolve
to throw away all their emotions is cool, but naturally creates
robotic acting as Will is good at it and Jaden tries to imitate the
emotionless style.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Jobs, starring Ashton Kutcher (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Jobs, starring Ashton Kutcher (2013)20131025
This was a fun movie. I enjoyed seeing Jobs struggle knowing that
he was so successful in the long-run. I feel like a lot of the
later technical achievements and little things like the motherboard
layout and innovations at NeXT were wrongly missed.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Much Ado About Nothing, by Joss Whedon (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Much Ado About Nothing, by Joss Whedon (2012)20131024
This was awesome. I love the Whedonverse actors and I love it when
versions of Shakespeare use the same language. It was very cute in
so many ways. I think the only problem was the "mob family" element
of having guns around wasn't explained enough in the imagery
compared to something like Baz Luhrmann's Romeo & Juliet.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: Man of Steel, starring Henry Cavill (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Man of Steel, starring Henry Cavill (2013)20131023
This was a really cool version of Super Man. I like that it spends
a lot more time in the world of Krypton and on its history and
mythology. I like that it shows Superman as very vulnerable and
uncertain of what he should do. It was really awesome.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Pacific Rim, by Guillermo del Toro (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Pacific Rim, by Guillermo del Toro (2013)20131021
This was a really fun movie. I enjoyed the connection to
Evangelion, which is the ultimate anime for me. There were lots of
cool things in it and I appreciate how it had to be the way it was
to get made. I wish that there was a little bit more about the
Kaiju and their connection to humanity, like the Angels have in
EVA, but it's okay.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Aero the Acrobat (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Aero the Acrobat (SNES, 1993)20131020
This was a joke of a game. It was clearly attempting to be
something like Sonic. It was marginally better than the Rocky and
Bullwinkle game, but still really terrible and impossible to
control and know where you were going or what you were supposed to
do. Ugh.

Total time: 0:06

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (31)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (31)20131020
I played this game for a little bit today. I tried the next DmD
level (mission 17) and didn't get very far. I feel like the combat
is really rote now. I have a strategy that works but just requires
a bit of finesse and luck to perfectly pull off. It isn't good
enough that I feel amazing trashing the enemies and it isn't bad
enough that I feel like I need to go learn a new
technique. Overall, it's made the game very bland for me.

Bayonetta felt a lot different than this, because you go to a
point with your dodging that you were just invincible and it was
great.

I tried the Heaven and Hell difficulty level on the first mission
and it was a total joke. You can just shot everything a single
time with your bullet and then knock away their shield if
necessary, even the boss. It's a bit funny to the extreme, but not
for more than a lark.

In the end, I found this game to be *very* good, but not as good
as Bayonetta or Metal Gear Rising.

Game     3: 10:15
Total time: 28:45
  • Video Games
  • DmC: Devil May Cry
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen (SNES, 1993)20131020
I played this for about an hour and did the first two missions. I
found the game to be very unfulfilling. It was very slow and you
had no control during battles. I get the impression that it will
be super easy until suddenly it is insanely hard. I'm not too
excited about going through something like that. I can appreciate
what was interesting about the game for people who originally
played it though, I think.

Total time: 0:55
  • Video Games
  • Ogre Battle: March of the Black Queen
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Run Saber (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Run Saber (SNES, 1993)20131020
I played through this with an Infinite Lives cheat to see how it
was. It felt really sloppy and imprecise for my taste. I think in
its attempt to be flashy, it lost something. In particular, I
didn't like the way the jump was so floaty and you could easily
wiggle out of where you wanted to be. I also didn't like that it
was hard to do a short jump without grabbing on to the
ceiling. Altogether, it was awkward to maneuver and it just felt
like a floppy mess.

I like my melee action games more like Castlevania and Ninja
Gaiden than this.

Total time: 0:34
  • Video Games
  • Run Saber
  • SNES
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Super Bomberman (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Super Bomberman (SNES, 1993)20131020
This is a classic example of a great game that you can't play for
too long at once. I enjoy the formula... it's kind of like a
puzzle and kind of like an action game. A very odd mix.

I got to 2-3 with password 5012.

entry.title: Game: Super Turrican (SNES, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Super Turrican (SNES, 1993)20131020
This was a big silly stupid action game. It's like Contra, except
you are so much more powerful and the weapons are much more
insane. The most interesting thing about it was the way the
power-ups worked like an old shmup: as you got more of the same
color, that kind of shot got powerful, but you could mess with
yourself by switching to something weak by accident. It wasn't
that interesting.

Total time: 0:13
  • Video Games
  • Super Turrican
  • SNES
  • 1993
